description.para: Auxiliary macros for creating endpoint identifiers compatible with the USB specification.

detaileddescription.para: Simple macro to create IN endpoint identifier for given endpoint number.

simplesect.para: Endpoint identifier that connects endpoint number and endpoint direction.

detaileddescription.para: Simple macro to create OUT endpoint identifier for given endpoint number.

simplesect.para: Endpoint identifier that connects endpoint number and endpoint direction.

briefdescription.para: Number of bytes in the endpoint.
Number of bytes for isochronous endpoints.

detaileddescription.para:
Number of bytes for isochronous endpoints in total. This number would be shared between IN and OUT endpoint. It may be also assigned totaly to one endpoint.
nrf_usbd_isosplit_set
nrf_usbd_isosplit_get

briefdescription.para: The size of internal feeder buffer.
Auxiliary macro for declaring IN transfer description with optional flags.

detaileddescription.para: The base macro for creating transfers with any configuration option.

simplesect.para: Configured variable with total transfer description.

briefdescription.para: Helper macro for declaring OUT transfer item (nrfx_usbd_transfer_t).

detaileddescription.para: Endpoint OUT 0
Endpoint OUT 1
Endpoint OUT 2
Endpoint OUT 3
Endpoint OUT 4
Endpoint OUT 5
Endpoint OUT 6
Endpoint OUT 7
Endpoint OUT 8
Endpoint IN 0
Endpoint IN 1
Endpoint IN 2
Endpoint IN 3
Endpoint IN 4
Endpoint IN 5
Endpoint IN 6
Endpoint IN 7
Endpoint IN 8
Endpoint identifier used in the driver. This endpoint number is consistent with USB 2.0 specification.
Start Of Frame event on USB bus detected.
Reset condition on USB bus detected.
This device should go to suspend mode now.
This device should resume from suspend now.
Wakeup request - the USBD peripheral is ready to generate WAKEUP signal after exiting low power mode.
Setup frame received and decoded.

For Rx (OUT: Host->Device):
The packet has been received but there is no buffer prepared for transfer already.
Whole transfer has been finished.
For Tx (IN: Device->Host): The last packet from requested transfer has been transfered over USB bus and acknowledged.
Number of defined events.
Enumeration of possible events that may be generated by the driver.
No error occured.
Data received, no buffer prepared already - waiting for configured transfer.

Received number of bytes cannot fit given buffer. This error would also be returned when next_transfer function has been defined but currently received data cannot fit completely in current buffer. No data split from single endpoint transmission is supported.
When this error is reported - data is left inside endpoint buffer. Clear endpoint or prepare new buffer and read it.
EP0 transfer can be aborted when new setup comes. Any other transfer can be aborted by USB reset or driver stopping.
Transfer is in progress.
Status codes that may be returned by nrfx_usbd_ep_status_get or, except for NRFX_USBD_EP_BUSY, reported together with NRFX_USBD_EVT_EPTRANSFER.
Flags configured for the transfer that can be merged using the bitwise 'or' operator (|).

memberdef.definition: typedef bool(* nrfx_usbd_feeder_t) (nrfx_usbd_ep_transfer_t *p_next, void *p_context, size_t ep_size)
memberdef.name: nrfx_usbd_feeder_t

detaileddescription.para: Pointer for a transfer feeder. Transfer feeder is a feedback function used to prepare a single TX (Device->Host) endpoint transfer.

The transfers provided by the feeder must be simple:
The size of the transfer provided by this function is limited to a single endpoint buffer. Bigger transfers are not handled automatically in this case.
Flash transfers are not automatically supported- you must copy them to the RAM buffer before.

simplesect.para: This function may use nrfx_usbd_feeder_buffer_get to gain a temporary buffer that can be used to prepare transfer.

parameterdescription.para: Structure with the data for the next transfer to be filled. Required only if the function returns true.
Context variable configured with the transfer.
The current transfer is the last one - you do not need to call the function again.
There is more data to be prepared and when the current transfer finishes, the feeder function is expected to be called again.

memberdef.definition: typedef bool(* nrfx_usbd_consumer_t) (nrfx_usbd_ep_transfer_t *p_next, void *p_context, size_t ep_size, size_t data_size)
memberdef.name: nrfx_usbd_consumer_t

detaileddescription.para: Pointer for a transfer consumer. Transfer consumer is a feedback function used to prepare a single RX (Host->Device) endpoint transfer.
The transfer must provide a buffer big enough to fit the whole data from the endpoint. Otherwise, the NRFX_USBD_EP_OVERLOAD event is generated.

parameterdescription.para: Structure with the data for the next transfer to be filled. Required only if the function returns true.
Context variable configured with the transfer.
Number of received bytes in the endpoint buffer.
Current transfer is the last one - you do not need to call the function again.
There is more data to be prepared and when current transfer finishes, the feeder function is expected to be called again.
Event handler provided by the user. Cannot be null.
The driver is already initialized. Deprecated - use NRFX_ERROR_ALREADY instead.

briefdescription.para: Function for checking if the USBD driver is initialized.

detaileddescription.para: After calling this function USBD peripheral would be enabled. The USB LDO would be enabled. Enabled USBD peripheral would request HFCLK. This function does not enable external oscillator, so if it is not enabled by other part of the program after enabling USBD driver HFINT would be used for the USBD peripheral. It is perfectly fine until USBD is started. See nrfx_usbd_start.
In normal situation this function should be called in reaction to USBDETECTED event from POWER peripheral.
Interrupts and USB pins pull-up would stay disabled until nrfx_usbd_start function is called.
After calling this function USBD peripheral would be disabled. No events would be detected or processed by the driver. Clock for the peripheral would be disconnected.
After calling this function USBD peripheral should be fully functional and all new incoming events / interrupts would be processed by the driver.
Also only after calling this function host sees new connected device.
Call this function when USBD power LDO regulator is ready - on USBPWRRDY event from POWER peripheral.
Before USBD interrupts are enabled, external HFXO is requested.

parameterdescription.para: The flag that is used to enable SOF processing. If it is false, SOF interrupt is left disabled and will not be generated. This improves power saving if SOF is not required.

simplesect.para: If the isochronous endpoints are going to be used, it is required to enable the SOF. In other case any isochronous endpoint would stay busy after first transmission.

detaileddescription.para: This function disables USBD pull-up and interrupts.
The HFXO request is released in this function.

simplesect.para: This function can also be used to logically disconnect USB from the HOST that would force it to enumerate device after calling nrfx_usbd_start.
The USBD peripheral interrupt state is checked.

detaileddescription.para: The USBD peripheral is forced to go into the low power mode. The function has to be called in the reaction to NRFX_USBD_EVT_SUSPEND event when the firmware is ready.
After successful call of this function most of the USBD registers would be unavailable.

simplesect.para: Check returned value for the feedback if suspending was successful.

parameterdescription.para: USBD peripheral was not suspended due to resume detection.

detaileddescription.para: The USBD peripheral is forced to quit the low power mode. After calling this function all the USBD registers would be available.
The hardware starts measuring time when wake up is possible. This may take 0-5ms depending on how long the SUSPEND state was kept on the USB line.
When NRFX_USBD_EVT_WUREQ event is generated it means that Wake Up signaling has just been started on the USB lines.

simplesect.para: Do not expect only NRFX_USBD_EVT_WUREQ event. There always may appear NRFX_USBD_EVT_RESUME event.
NRFX_USBD_EVT_WUREQ event means that Remote WakeUp signal has just begun to be generated. This may take up to 20ms for the bus to become active.

parameterdescription.para: No WakeUp procedure started - bus is already active.

briefdescription.para: Check if USBD is in SUSPEND mode.

simplesect.para: This is the information about peripheral itself, not about the bus state.

briefdescription.para: Enable only interrupts that should be processed in SUSPEND mode.

detaileddescription.para: Auxiliary function to help with SUSPEND mode integration. It enables only the interrupts that can be properly processed without stable HFCLK.
Normally all the interrupts are enabled. Use this function to suspend interrupt processing that may require stable HFCLK until the clock is enabled.
Default interrupt configuration. Use in a pair with nrfx_usbd_active_irq_config.
This function checks if the bus state is suspended.

simplesect.para: The value returned by this function changes on SUSPEND and RESUME event processing.

briefdescription.para: Force the bus state to active.
Configure packet size that should be supported by the endpoint.

detaileddescription.para: The real endpoint buffer size is always the same. This value sets max packet size that would be transmitted over the endpoint. This is required by the driver.

simplesect.para: Endpoint size is always set to NRFX_USBD_EPSIZE or NRFX_USBD_ISOSIZE / 2 when nrfx_usbd_ep_enable function is called.

detaileddescription.para: Function to get configured endpoint size on the buffer.

simplesect.para: Maximum pocket size configured on selected endpoint.

briefdescription.para: Check if the selected endpoint is enabled.

detaileddescription.para: This function enables endpoint itself and its interrupts.

simplesect.para: Max packet size is set to endpoint default maximum value.

detaileddescription.para: This function disables endpoint itself and its interrupts.

briefdescription.para: Disable all endpoints except for EP0.

detaileddescription.para: Disable all endpoints that can be disabled in USB device while it is still active.
Function initializes endpoint transmission. This is asynchronous function - it finishes immediately after configuration for transmission is prepared.

simplesect.para: Data buffer pointed by p_data have to be kept active till NRFX_USBD_EVT_EPTRANSFER event is generated.

parameterdescription.para: Endpoint number. For IN endpoint sending would be initiated. For OUT endpoint receiving would be initiated.
Unexpected transfer on EPIN0 or EPOUT0.

briefdescription.para: Start sending data over the endpoint using the transfer handler function.

detaileddescription.para: This function initializes an endpoint transmission. Just before data is transmitted, the transfer handler is called and it prepares a data chunk.

parameterdescription.para: Endpoint number. For an IN endpoint, sending is initiated. For an OUT endpoint, receiving is initiated.
Transfer handler - feeder for IN direction and consumer for OUT direction.
Unexpected transfer on EPIN0 or EPOUT0.

briefdescription.para: Get the temporary buffer to be used by the feeder.

detaileddescription.para: This buffer is used for TX transfers and it can be reused automatically when the transfer is finished. Use it for transfer preparation.
May be used inside the feeder configured in nrfx_usbd_ep_handled_transfer.

simplesect.para: Pointer to the buffer that can be used temporarily.

briefdescription.para: Get the information about last finished or current transfer.

detaileddescription.para: Function returns the status of the last buffer set for transfer on selected endpoint. The status considers last buffer set by nrfx_usbd_ep_transfer function or by transfer callback function.

parameterdescription.para: Information about the current/last transfer size.

simplesect.para: Endpoint status.

detaileddescription.para: Get the number of received bytes. The function behavior is undefined when called on IN endpoint.

simplesect.para: Number of received bytes.

briefdescription.para: Check if endpoint buffer is ready or is under USB IP control.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to test if endpoint is busy. Endpoint that is busy cannot be accessed by MCU. It means that:
OUT (TX) endpoint: Last uploaded data is still in endpoint and is waiting to be received by the host.
IN (RX) endpoint: Endpoint is ready to receive data from the host and the endpoint does not have any data. When endpoint is not busy:
OUT (TX) endpoint: New data can be uploaded.
IN (RX) endpoint: New data can be downloaded using nrfx_usbd_ep_transfer function.
Stall endpoit to send error information during next transfer request from the host.

simplesect.para: To stall endpoint it is safer to use nrfx_usbd_setup_stall
Stalled endpoint would not be cleared when DMA transfer finishes.

detaileddescription.para:
This function clears endpoint that is stalled.
If it is OUT endpoint (receiving) it would be also prepared for reception. It means that busy flag would be set.
In endpoint (transmitting) would not be cleared - it gives possibility to write new data before transmitting.
ep
Endpoint number.
This function gets stall state of selected endpoint.
Function fills the parsed setup data structure.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to data structure that would be filled by parsed data.

briefdescription.para: Clear the control endpoint for packet reception during DATA stage.

detaileddescription.para:
This function may be called if any more data in control write transfer is expected. Clears only OUT endpoint to be able to take another OUT data token. It does not allow STATUS stage.
nrfx_usbd_setup_clear
This function acknowledges setup when SETUP command was received and processed. It has to be called if no data respond for the SETUP command is sent.
Mark an error on setup endpoint.

briefdescription.para: Abort pending transfer on selected endpoint.
Get the information about expected transfer SETUP data direction.

detaileddescription.para: Function returns the information about last expected transfer direction.

parameterdescription.para: Expecting OUT (Host->Device) direction or no data.
